programme.title: Ancient Murders Unearthed
programme.desc: Homicide detective Rod Demery and forensic scientist Turi King examine a skeleton dated to the time of the Picts and unearthed in a remote sea cave in Scotland; the team recreate the attack to deduce the victim's most likely killer.

programme.title: Terror!
programme.desc: Algeria had been a colony of France for more than a century when a young Algerian woman visited a bar in the European quarter of Algiers, planted a bomb beneath her seat and left Sept. 30, 1956.

programme.title: Terror!
programme.desc: Members of the Irgun, the Jewish resistance movement, smuggle milk churns backed with explosives into the basement of Jerusalem's King David Hotel, headquarters of the British Army in Palestine, on July 22, 1946.

programme.title: CSI on Trial
programme.desc: David Gavitt served almost 27 years in prison before new arson investigation science exonerated him, but countless others remain behind bars; the science behind crime scene investigations moves forward, but legal precedent only looks backward.

programme.title: Cracking the Code

programme.title: Cracking the Code
programme.desc: The desperate bid to break the complex coded messages of the Zodiac, America's most mysterious serial killer.

programme.title: Cracking the Code
programme.desc: A naval officer with a penchant for crosswords attempts stop the Japanese onslaught and turn the War in the Pacific in America's favor following the horror of the attack on Pearl Harbor.

programme.title: Cracking the Code
programme.desc: The deciphering of a mysterious ancient language and the unlocking its secrets is a 50-year obsessive journey that rewrites history.

programme.desc: Bumpy must turn the Five Families against Chin when he violates their peace agreement; he tasks newcomer Frank Lucas with robbing a shipment of Gigante heroin; Elise learns of a plot to kill Omar; Stella makes a play to become boss of the family.

programme.title: The Greatest Show on Earth
programme.desc: A high-wire artist, the girlfriend (Betty Hutton) of a circus manager (Charlton Heston), falls for a French aerialist (Cornel Wilde).

programme.title: Wild Bill
programme.desc: The legendary gunfighter (Jeff Bridges) resumes romance with Calamity Jane (Ellen Barkin), faces an upstart and copes with his past in late-1800s Dakota Territory.

programme.title: Wild Bill
programme.desc: The legendary gunfighter (Jeff Bridges) resumes romance with Calamity Jane (Ellen Barkin), faces an upstart and copes with his past in late-1800s Dakota Territory.

programme.title: Whiskey Tango Foxtrot
programme.desc: In 2002, cable news producer Kim Barker shakes up her routine by covering the war in Kabul, Afghanistan.

programme.title: The Thomas Crown Affair
programme.desc: The mastermind (Steve McQueen) of a Boston bank caper falls in love with the insurance sleuth (Faye Dunaway) on his trail.

programme.title: Nickel Boys
programme.desc: Elwood Curtis' college dreams are shattered when he's sentenced to a brutal reformatory in the Jim Crow South. Clinging to his optimistic worldview, Elwood strikes up a friendship with a fellow Black teen who dispenses fundamental tips for survival.

programme.title: The Fire Inside
programme.desc: The story of Claressa "T-Rex" Shields, a boxer from Flint, Mich., who trained to become the first woman in her country's history to win an Olympic gold medal in the sport.

programme.title: Clockstoppers
programme.desc: A teenager (Jesse Bradford) accidentally activates a wristwatch that allows him to make time stand still.

programme.title: Small Soldiers
programme.desc: A boy (Gregory Smith) and his neighborhood crush (Kirsten Dunst) become involved in a war when a faulty microchip turns toy soldiers into a tiny but lethal army.

programme.title: Transformers One
programme.desc: Brothers-in-arms Orion Pax and D-16 become sworn enemies Optimus Prime and Megatron.

programme.title: Godfather of Harlem
programme.desc: When the property for Bumpy's new club is being sold to a powerful, white real-estate developer, Bumpy must convince the black "Straw Man" to sell it to him instead; Mayme and Elise stage a protest at Margaret's school.

programme.title: Sonic the Hedgehog 3
programme.desc: Sonic, Knuckles and Tails reunite to battle Shadow, a mysterious new enemy with powers unlike anything they've faced before. With their abilities outmatched in every way, they seek out an unlikely alliance to stop Shadow and protect the planet.

programme.title: IF
programme.desc: After discovering she can see everyone's imaginary friends, a girl embarks on a magical adventure to reconnect forgotten IFs with their kids.

programme.title: Prophecy
programme.desc: A government doctor (Robert Foxworth) and his pregnant wife (Talia Shire) find Maine animals mutated by industrial pollution.

programme.title: The Magnificent Seven

programme.title: The Night of the Hunter
programme.desc: The Rev. Harry Powell, a religious fanatic and serial killer, meets condemned murderer Ben Harper in prison, who tells him about hiding $10,000 in stolen loot. After he's released, Powell tracks down Harper's widow, Willa, and her two children.

programme.title: Foxy Brown
programme.desc: A nurse (Pam Grier) takes revenge on a drug ring for the slaying of her undercover-officer boyfriend.

programme.title: Alive
programme.desc: Following the conflicts in Iraq and Afghanistan, injured veterans turn to adaptive athletics to heal their physical and emotional battle wounds.

programme.title: The Madness of King George

programme.title: Save the Last Dance
programme.desc: A white teenager (Julia Stiles) moves to Chicago after her mother's death and falls for a black student (Sean Patrick Thomas) who shares her love of dance.

programme.title: The Boys in the Boat
programme.desc: During the height of the Great Depression, members of the rowing team at the University of Washington get thrust into the spotlight as they compete for gold at the 1936 Olympics in Berlin.

programme.title: September 5
programme.desc: During the 1972 Munich Olympics, an American sports broadcasting crew finds itself thrust into covering the hostage crisis involving Israeli athletes.

programme.title: Mississippi Burning
programme.desc: Two FBI agents face racism while investigating the disappearance of three civil rights activists in 1964 Mississippi.

programme.title: Creed
programme.desc: Long-retired boxer Rocky Balboa (Sylvester Stallone) agrees to train Apollo Creed's son (Michael B. Jordan) to become a fighter, even as the former champ battles an opponent deadlier than any he ever faced in the ring.

programme.title: Eye of the Needle
programme.desc: A Nazi spy (Donald Sutherland) seduces the wife (Kate Nelligan) of a crippled pilot (Christopher Cazenove) on the Scottish coast before D-Day.

programme.title: Poltergeist II: The Other Side
programme.desc: An American Indian helps a broke and homeless family (JoBeth Williams, Craig T. Nelson), once again prey to a poltergeist (Julian Beck).

programme.title: Battle of Britain
programme.desc: With London facing almost certain annihilation, British fighter pilots defend their skies against Germany's Luftwaffe.

programme.title: Harold and Maude
programme.desc: A 20-year-old heir (Bud Cort) with a death wish meets a 79-year-old free spirit (Ruth Gordon) who knows how to live.

programme.title: Days of Heaven
programme.desc: Migrant lovers (Richard Gere, Brooke Adams) and a little sister con a rich wheat farmer (Sam Shepard) in 1910s Texas.

programme.title: Sleeping With the Enemy
programme.desc: The battered wife (Julia Roberts) of a yuppie neat-freak (Patrick Bergin) fakes her death at sea and flees from Cape Cod to Iowa.

programme.title: Panic Room
programme.desc: A divorced woman and her diabetic daughter take refuge in their newly-purchased house's safe room when three men break-in, searching for a missing fortune.

programme.title: Blink Twice
programme.desc: When tech billionaire Slater King meets Frida, he invites her to join him and his friends for a dream vacation on his private island. However, when strange things start to happen, she'll have to uncover the truth if she hopes to make it out alive.

programme.title: Zoolander 2
programme.desc: A special agent recruits former models Derek Zoolander and Hansel to save the world's most beautiful people from a deadly plot.

programme.title: The Pulse With Bill Anderson
programme.desc: The Pulse with Bill Anderson is a weekly tv program and podcast featuring topical discussions and interviews surrounding current local issues, events, and entertainment. Each week Bill will welcome guests from all walks of life to talk about the topics that have the attention of our community and beyond. The Pulse will air weekly on FOX 29 in Philly as well as FOX Soul nationwide and be distributed on all major podcast outlets. In addition to hosting The Pulse Bill also manages the content of the station's special reports, including the Our Race Reality series of segments and specials. He also reports on the brighter side of life in his regular news series For Goodness' Sake.

programme.title: The Nightcap
programme.desc: On The Nightcap we explore and question other lifestyles and cultures with an enthusiastic, open mind and hope to leave our viewers happily pondering new perspectives. The show's unique set has a full bar with a rotating cast of bartenders pouring up unique cocktails you can try to replicate at home. Whether it's inviting the most provocative guests to the signature pink couch or hearing your take on controversial topics, the conversations never disappoint. From game night to ordering in munchies, The Nightcap will keep you wanting more. It's sexy, it's risqué, it's everything you wouldn't expect from late-night TV.

programme.title: Divorce Court
programme.desc: The venerable courtroom show takes a look at real-life couples. The soon-to-be exes tell their stories to the judge, who gives the ruling and settles all the usual -- and unusual -- divorce issues by the end of the episode. This is the third incarnation of the show titled "Divorce Court," with the first having premiered in 1957.
